intro: Allium anceps var. lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon onion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves and pale purple to white flowers. The plant produces small, rounded bulbs that are often used in traditional herbal practices. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
